data.title: Pink Warrior House
data.text:
The Mission of the Pink Warrior House Foundation is to provide a community which supports those battling breast cancer, and their caregiver(s), with emotional and social services to foster hope and positive outcomes.

The Pink Warrior House offers support groups, counseling, art therapy, yoga, meditation and mindfulness classes and experiences, our Beautiful Warrior makeup and skincare classes with high quality products, nutritional support, a wig exchange with a professional stylist, a monthly virtual lecture series, a ‚ÄúBattle Buddy‚Äù network to pair those newly diagnosed with someone who has been through a similar fight, and so much more! All services are available at no cost to anyone personally impacted by breast cancer.

In collaboration with Lovelace Embrace, PWH is thrilled to host Yoga and Guided Relaxation, every Tuesday (except July 4th this month) from 5:00-6:30pm via Zoom.

Yoga and Guided Relaxation

These free yoga classes are designed specifically for patients who have been diagnosed and treated for cancer. The focus of these classes is on stretching and strengthening with special attention to areas affected by treatment for breast cancer. It is coupled with guided relaxation. The relaxation techniques offered in this class will provide creative mind and body practices that help to reduce stress caused by the cancer journey. You may choose to participate in both sessions or one of the two.

EVERY TUESDAY:

5:00-5:45 p.m. Gentle yoga class designed to support all stages of treatment and recovery with modifications and options for all levels.

5:45-5:50 p.m. Short Intermission

5:50-6:30 p.m. Guided relaxation using Yoga Nidra techniques to develop deep rest supporting emotional and physical healing.

THIS CLASS WILL BE VIRTUAL ONLY UNTIL LATE SUMMER 2024!

ZOOM LINK

Join via Zoom by clicking here.

https://us02web.zoom.us/j/4809260101

About the instructor

Joan Sberro completed her 200 hour Yoga Teacher Training at Desert Song Healing Arts in Phoenix, AZ, focusing on foundational alignment and therapeutics. She has an additional 100 hour certification in Yoga of the Heart, yoga for cardiac and cancer care from Abundant Well Being, as well as a 300 hour certification in Yoga Philosophy from Embodied Philosophy. Her primary teaching emphasis is on fundamentals of yoga practice, meditation and philosophy and believes that everyone can benefit from the myriad paths of yoga.

Come join us for a monthly day of support at New Mexico Cancer Center!

We will be at NMCC Albuquerque (4901 Lang Ave NE, Albuquerque, NM 87109) on the first Wednesday of each month, and NMCC Gallup (2240 College Drive, Gallup, NM 87301) from 10:00am to 2:00pm, and on the third Wednesday of each month, from 11:00am to 2:00pm.

We will offer Beautiful Warrior makeup and skincare classes, yoga with guided mediation, art therapy activities, and a peer led talking circle for each event, nutrition with Kevin & Dani from Functional Source Nutrition and more! We will also be serving lunch at each Women‚Äôs Care Wednesday Gathering.

In Albuquerque and Gallup, we will have art therapy, meditation, intentional movement, and a Beautiful Warrior experience!

It is not necessary to be a patient at New Mexico Cancer Center, but all attendees must be personally affected by cancer (or a caregiver of someone who is).

Please contact allison@pinkwarriorhouse.org with any questions, or for additional details regarding this event.

This is a wonderful group of Warriors, from all ages and stages, coming together to support one another through the journey of breast cancer. It is a peer support group, facilitated by other breast cancer thrivers.

This group is VIRTUAL ONLY on the first and third Wednesday‚Äôs of every month.

We‚Äôre looking forward to seeing you virtually on August 7th! üíï

Allison Hendricks-Smith is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Topic: PWH All Ages & Stages Support Group

Time: Aug 7, 2024 05:30 PM Mountain Time (US and Canada)

Join Zoom Meeting

https://us06web.zoom.us/j/84487700126?pwd=7qmWP1B8ORFSgvbVWnxhlh9s4aaGgd.1

Meeting ID: 844 8770 0126

Passcode: 062381

Many of you have asked how you can help and support this beautiful community by volunteering your time and talents, and share more time together, with one another.

So, throughout the year we will be hosting periodic Volunteer Days, with different projects. Some options may include assembling Warrior Bags and Beautiful Warrior Bags, handwriting cards for our new Warriors. Learning to become Battle Buddies, helping prepare for upcoming events, and more!

For this month, we will be assembling Warrior Bags as a gift of love to those newly on this journey. üíï

Our monthly in-person Caregiver Groups are the second Monday of each month.

These monthly gatherings will be for the loved ones of all cancer thrivers as they navigate the journey of caring for and supporting someone on this difficult journey.

It will be a peer led group, co-facilitated by Chris Smith and Amy Liotta who both lovingly walked beside their spouses and other family members while they were battling cancer.

The group will be hosted at the Canteen Brewhouse, on the patio, in an area that will be reserved specifically for our group. These groups will be on the second Monday evening of every month.

The group will be from 6:00-7:00, but someone will be there as early as 5:30 to greet you. So, we encourage caregivers to come grab a drink and/or some food, and get acquainted before the group begins at 6:00pm.

Warriors, if you want to accompany your caregiver to Canteen that is wonderful, however the group portion itself will be limited to caregivers only to give them their own space in which to share and support one another.

Please spread the word, and share with the caregivers in your life. Let‚Äôs help support our caregivers the way they love and support us each and every day! üíï

Pink Warrior House, Lovelace Embrace and the Young Survival Coalition co-host this monthly gathering.

We hope you can join us, as this is a chance to meet other young women who have been through similar diagnosis, treatment and life changes.

Going through Breast Cancer is difficult at any age, but going through it at a younger age presents some unique challenges. You are not alone! good company guaranteed!

This meeting can be attended virtually or in-person. The Zoom link can be found below for your reference.

We hope to see you! üíï

Allison Hendricks-Smith is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Topic: Monthly Young Survivor Meeting

Time: Aug 14, 2024 06:00 PM Mountain Time (US and Canada)

Join Zoom Meeting

https://us06web.zoom.us/j/85334974686?pwd=6MvlyZ0IulPsUOabs25X4xDGx3mjBK.1

Meeting ID: 853 3497 4686

Passcode: 313638

For this installment on our Monthly (Virtual) Lecture Series, we welcome Denise Gonzalez from Allure Spa & Lounge.

Denise is a professionally trained nipple and areola tattoo artist. She trained under Jeanine McTasney who is world renowned in the process of nipple and areola tattooing. Denise will be talking to us about the process of this procedure, and answering any questions any of you may have.

We hope you can join us for this exciting and informative (virtual) event! üíï

Allison Hendricks-Smith is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Topic: Monthly Lecture - Nipple & Areola Tattooing

Time: Aug 15, 2024 06:00 PM Mountain Time (US and Canada)

Join Zoom Meeting

https://us06web.zoom.us/j/86194262011?pwd=CWnjKJpxfpZCiKh2Y2rKJjtVzD2aow.1

Meeting ID: 861 9426 2011

Passcode: 726820

This group will focus on nutrition and fitness in the battle against breast cancer.

It will be a mostly virtual group, meeting on the third Tuesday evening of each month, from 5:30-6:30pm.

We will feature an expert in the field of nutrition or fitness each month, to share helpful information, answer your questions, and provide materials to help you on your journey toward wellness.

We hope you can join us for this fun and informative group! üíï

Allison Hendricks-Smith is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Topic: Monthly Fitness & Nutrition Group

Time: Aug 20, 2024 05:30 PM Mountain Time (US and Canada)

Join Zoom Meeting

https://us06web.zoom.us/j/89662297913?pwd=G19TgYMC57oWVPDtooMYM6LgiroD4T.1

Passcode: 802000

This is a wonderful group of Warriors, from all ages and stages, coming together to support one another through the journey of breast cancer. It is a peer support group, facilitated by other breast cancer thrivers.

This group is VIRTUAL ONLY on the first and third Wednesday‚Äôs of every month.

We‚Äôre looking forward to seeing you virtually on August 21st! üíï

As our community of Pink Warriors grows, we have many more members who are on the journey specific to metastatic disease (Stage IV). We understand that some of your needs and experiences are unique, and we want to provide a forum where you can come together (virtually) with other metastatic warriors to share, listen, and support one another.

This group will be offered in collaboration with Amy Bellomo Robinson, and the Radiant Healing Together Community.

We will be meeting virtually on the third Thursday of every month. This will be a virtual only gathering. Please find the Zoom link below for your reference.

We hope you can join us! üíï

Allison Hendricks-Smith is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Topic: Monthly Metastatic Group

Time: Aug 22, 2024 05:00 PM Mountain Time (US and Canada)

Join Zoom Meeting

https://us06web.zoom.us/j/84297371643?pwd=mgjHNdbinldb9OTtRH3f74TReCZdcg.1

Meeting ID: 842 9737 1643

Passcode: 107329

We are so excited to again partner with Patti, and CSP Dance Studios to offer you monthly dance parties (with professional instruction) on the 4th Friday of each month.

Patti, and her incredible team at CSP Dance Studios (https://www.cspdancestudios.com) are hosting our Pink Warrior House Community for an hour of professional dance instruction, followed by free dance and socializing.

We are thrilled to be able to offer this fun and enjoyable event to our monthly calendar. We are hoping to keep growing this group so please encourage your friends and family to come along, just be sure to include them in your RSVP when you register.

As with all PWH classes, groups and workshops, this is a free event to anyone personally impacted by breast cancer, and their caregivers/loved ones.

We can‚Äôt wait to see you on August 23rd for DANCING! üíï

Yin Yoga Salt Cave Yoga & Sound Bath.

The Salt Cave provides an immersive self-care and wellness experience where you can enjoy a variety of services including dry salt therapy in a large salt cave!

This is a 60-minute yoga session in the salt cave, with Allison Hendricks-Smith as instructor.

This session is limited to 13 breast cancer thrivers.

We anticipate that this class will end up on a waitlist.

If all 13 spots are taken, and you are interested in being added to the waitlist, please reach out to Allison.

We are paying for each individual slot, so that this can be a free program through PWH. So, if you commit to a space, and are unable to attend, please remove yourself from the RSVP, so that someone from the waitlist may attend accordingly.

Yin Restorative Yoga allows for the body to slow down, relax, and turn inward which helps alleviate stress and restore the body‚Äôs energy levels, while improving flexibility, boosting circulation, and reduces tension. The Salt Cave will help alleviate stress and anxiety as well. It provides a relaxing environment with a tranquil atmosphere, making it the perfect haven for mindfulness.

While ‚Äúyang‚Äù yoga focuses on your muscles, yin yoga targets your deep connective tissues, like your fascia, ligaments, and joints. It‚Äôs slower and more meditative, giving you space to turn inward and tune into both your mind and the physical sensations of your body. Because you‚Äôre holding poses for a longer period of time than you would in other traditional types of yoga, yin yoga helps you stretch and lengthen those rarely used tissues while also teaching you how to breathe through discomfort and sit with your thoughts.

We hope to see you on August 24th! üíï

This is a wonderful opportunity for all of our Warriors navigating the challenges of life on the other side of active treatment. Those navigating their ‚Äúnew normal‚Äù as NED (no evidence of disease) have an opportunity to get together and discuss the mental and emotional challenges that come after chemo, radiation, and/or surgery.

This group will be IN-PERSON ONLY on the last Wednesday of each month.

We hope to see you in-person on August 28th! üíï

For this month‚Äôs art therapy activity, we will be working on creating Towers of Self-Esteem. While this exercise focuses on self-esteem, it can also be used as a way to explore your current strengths and abilities as a foundation to building confidence in all areas of your life!

This group will be peer hosted by Allison Hendricks-Smith, LMHC, Master‚Äôs in Art Therapy/Counseling, and breast cancer survivor.

No creative experience is required, and as with all Pink Warrior House offerings, this group is open to anyone personally impacted by breast cancer.

Please see the artwork in the invitation for an example of our upcoming activity.

This is an in-person only workshop, and all materials will be provided.

We hope to see you at Pink Warrior House! üíï
